result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Barker III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, James A Barker III was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James A Barker III is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • James A Barker III was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of supervision.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time.   No contact with Cree or its employees (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co-defendant's or witnesses, S.A., J.G. J.G. (person, property, residence or family). No work online that includes sale of merchandise without agent approval. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

01:32 PM Defendant James A Barker in court.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter: Brady Bish.
The Court notes there was a filing by the defendant and it is an ex parte communication; a copy was provided to Ms. Johnson
The Court notes, for the record, he spent the last 15 minutes on the telephone with Jeremiah VanHeicke and the Court feels it can be fair and impartial. BTC: The Court denies the deft's request.
The defendant objects. The Court also notes that there was a previous motion to reduce the previous bond and hears argument from the defendant. The State filed a response and notes she filed a response; the bond wasn't divided by count and the defendant has been found guilty by jury. BTC: Motion to reduce bond is denied.
Defedant requests the sentencing be adjourned once again. The State, although she wishes to be done with this matter, does not want the taxpayers to pay for the deft's treatment. She doesn't have enough information on the defendant's prognosis. The State suggest the Court contact the defenant's doctor and see what the prognosis is.
BTC: Motion to adjourn is denied.
The Defendant indicates he has not reviewed the PSI as he could not print it because it is a confidential document. The PSI is printed for the defendant and deft is allowed to have a family member read it to him in the Courtroom conference room.
Back on the record at 2:26 pm. No additions or corrections noted by the State. The defendant indicates he has had opportunity to review the PSI and puts corrections on the record. The attorney for the victim addresses the Court.
The State makes sentencing argument to the Court.

Defendant James A Barker in court.   Haley Jo Johnson appeared as a special prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.    Court reporter: Brady Bish.  Discovery issues still exist.  Reports were provided to the defendant.  280 pages were available.  Mr. Barker was unable to study all the reports and could not make copies of the reports.  Documents were redacted and defendant felt that the redacted documents were extensivly redacted and the defendant felt that it was against State statute  Defendant did not use all of the time available to him to review the documents.  Defendant needs more time to review the documents.  Defendant wants copies of the reports.  Judge informed the defendant that he could come and continue to review the documents.  Defendant wants copies of the reports.  State is not opposed to providing copies of the reports as long of none of the reports will be released to anyone else and not to have them posted on social media.  State will prepare the order and email them to the defendant.  State supplied a copy of  the interviews with the Cree employees on a recording to the defendant.  Defendant insists there are more tapes and the State will look into this again.  State will provide any further recordings to the defendant.

In so far as preparing for trial, Judge has received witness lists from both parties.   Defendant still needs to serve Officer Schulman.  State suggested that the defendant serve the Officers attorney by email.  The attorney will make sure his client appears for Court.  Witness lists have been exchanged.  Judge deals with legal issues.  At a trial the jury will decide if the defendant is guilty or not guilty.    

Lisa Beck from CREE appears by speakerphone.  This party is allowed to listen but may not speak.

State has provided the Defendant with all of the tapes that are available at this time.
Ms. Schulman does not work for the County of Racine any longer.
Sgt. Mattke informs the Court that Ms. Schulman is still an employee of Racine County but she is now a Sergent.
Eric Deforte and Genella Gatzson are subpoenaed by the defendant regarding his revocation hearing.  The State believes it is irrelevant to this trial.  
The defendant argues as to why these State Employees should be heard.
The revocation hearing is not relevant to the truth of this trial as it is held in front of an Administrative Law Judge.  
Kim Winther is listed as a witness.  He is a medical examiner in Officer Schulman's case.  Information about the deceased person is redacted from the reports.  
Mr. Barker has provided voir dire questions he intends to use during trial as did the State.  Mr. Barker may have some civil questions included.  
State will provide a hard copy of  the proposed jury instructions to the defendant.  
State will provide the video copy to the defendant and the State will write a letter and file it with the court as to when that occured.

For the day of trial.   Judge must attend the Judicial Conference.  The new date of 11/13/18 is ok with both parties.  Mr. Barker can only be ready for trial if all of the discovery is provided ahead of time.  
The defendant insists that he is going to continue to represent himself.  
The redacted reports and the tape will be in the mail on Monday,October 29th. Defendant will need audio and video equipment available for trial.  

One last issue: On 8/1/18 a DST was filed.  Defendant is on bond.   He is not detained.  If we begin the trial in November it exceeds the DST timeline.  
Ends of justice are served by going outside the 90 days and that there is not a miscarriage of justice by the short delay.  The interests of the victims is also served by the continuance.  

Court is adjourned.

records.addlTxt:
Final pre-trial on October 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 30, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James A Barker in court, pro se.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jenny Vorpahl.
The Court notes that parties were asked to prepare voir dire questions so it can be determined if parties will ask their own questions or if the Court will ask all questions of the jury. Deft hasn't prepared any voir dire questions. Deft indicates he hasn't finished all his questions because he feels he hasn't received all discovery. The State will file their witness list and proposed jury instructions by the end of this week. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his desire to proceed pro se and his ability to proceed as his own counsel. The Court advises the deft if they want an atty, they must hire one as SPD will no longer appoint. BTC: Mr.Barker claims he cannot hire an atty based on the bond not being released as deft has asked. The Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to be represented by counsel based on Mr. Barker's actions.
Ms. Johnson indicates that the defendant previously wanted misdemeanors but the State is not willing to offer misdemeanors. The defendant insists on dismissal only or a trial. The State has received the documents submitted by the deft but hasn't had time to review same as she was in trial. Parties discuss if Lt. C. Schulman is on the State's witness list and will be called as a witness, deft is entitled to information regarding the case involving Lt. Schulman. If that information is released to the deft, the State asks for a protective order that will prohibit deft from posting on any social media sites or disclose any information regarding the reports. Defense objects. BTC: Ms. Johnson will provide the reports to AV, Criminal Court case manager who will make the reports available to the deft but the defendant may not photograph them or copy them. He is only to view them. Deft to call AV after 8/16
Deft object to the Court order. Deft demands interviews with Cree employees; the State will see if the reports of interviews exist and if so, will be provided to the defendant.
The State requests an adj of the trial.

BTC: new motions filed by deft are denied. The State to file jury instructions and witness list by the end of the week. Deft may submit his voir dire questions by the end of the week. If he does not, he may not ask questions of the prospective jurors.  Jury trial scheduled for October 30, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 18, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial on August 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James A Barker in court pro se.   Zeke Widenfeld (Walworth County) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Prior hearings reviewed.  Request by defendant for affidavit of indigency.  Defendant only filed the order portion, so no action has been taken on that request.  Additional documents had been mailed to last known address, however, defendant states he never received it.  Defendant received documents at court office, but has not completed them.  Subpoenaes were also provided.  Defendant advised that the county process server would serve any subpoena required.  Re issue of search warrants -- at the time of search warrant filing, they are kept in a file until charges are filed.  The original search warrants relevant to this case have been scanned.  
State calls Brian Graziano to explain search warrant procedures.  Defendant objects; he was not informed of testimony of this witness.  Objection overruled.  Witness sworn.  Direct examination by the State.  Cross examination by defendant.  Witness excused.
Defendant plays video (previously marked and reviewed 05/17/18).  
Remaining motions:  Motion to dismiss with prejudice.  Defense makes statement re dismissal.  Disputing validity of search warrant originals based on there being no embossed notary seal on them.  State makes statement regarding search warrants and testimony previously given.  State requests the Court deny defendant's motion to dismiss.  
BTC:  Pursuant to defendant's motion to dismiss on many grounds and issues.  Probable cause found for issuance of search warrants.  Court finds all search warrants are valid, and therefore, motion to dismiss based on invalid search warrants is denied.  Motion to dismiss is denied in its' entirety.
Prior to final pre-trial, parties are to submit potential voir dire questions.  State is also to submit possible jury instructions.

  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
by the State to Defendant's Motion on Defective Search Warrant.

Defendant James A Barker in court.  Attorney Haley Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

This matter is set to continue hearing the matters of Mr. Barker's Motion to dismiss. The court prepared an order denying Def. requests for the court to recuse itself from this case. The court contacted the clerk's office regarding the filing of the Petition and Order for Indigency. The Clerk's Office informed the court that Mr. Barker filed the order on 12/28 but did not file the Affidavit for indigency. Mr. Barker confirmed that he did not complete the filing. Mr. Barker has completed subpeona's for today's hearing. Mr. Barker filed a Motion on 5/16/18 to disqualify Atty Johnson from this case. Atty Johnson was on maternity leave which is why the Def. believes she withdrew from the case. Regarding the federal lawsuit, Atty Johnson contacted the bar. It was stated that she is a partial party, therefore there is no conflict for her to stay on this case. 
RE: Motion to Quash subpoena filed by MN. M.N. gives statement regarding the Motion he filed. Mr. Barker gives statement regarding M.N.'s statement. 
RE: Search warrants. Sgt. Brian Van Scyoc DSAT. c/e continues by James Barker. 
Mr. Barker states the recording equipment was returned but it was returned black. 
RE: Motion to quash trial subpoenas: Atty Johnsons goes trough the list of subpoenas. Gives statement regarding list. Requests that the court grant the quashing of subpoenas. 
Atty Serketich: was notified that subpoenas were served. Atty Serketich joins in with Atty Johnson's statment to have the trial subpoenas quashed. Gives explanation. Mr. Barker makes statement regarding Motion to quash subpoenas. 

BTC: The court is vacating its finding of spoliation until next Motion Hearing. Motion for disqualifying Atty Johnson is denied. Motion to quash trial subpoenas is granted. The state to be prepared to respond regarding the notary of search warrants. The state the make a record by COC for the process of filing of search warrants. Mr. Barker to contact the Clerk of Courts off to properly file the Indigency documents. Motion Hearing to be set on June 4, 2018 at 1:30pm to continue Mr. Barker's Motion to Dismiss.

Defendant James A Barker in court.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Elizabeth Kiel. 

Def. filed a Motion for the court to recuse itself. Def. believes that since the assigned judge signed a warrant that he should recuse himself from this case.
Atty Wiedenfeld believes that this court does have proper jurisdiction over this matter. 
Attorney Wiedenfeld: Br. 8  ordered that certain documents be copied and be presented to the Def. Def has not picked them up. Atty Wiedenfeld presents the documents def. in court.  
Def. filed a Motion to Dismiss. Def. states he did not come prepared to present the Motion to Dismiss. This matter has been set by Br. 8 a while ago. Def. is stating that he had no knowledge of what this matter was set for. Def. is requesting for adjournment of today's hearing. Attorney Wiedenfeld does not object to an adjournment. Def has intent to remove the D.A. He states that he filed a motion. Atty Wiedenfeld: There was an order appointing Atty Johnson from Walworth county. Atty Johnson is on paternity leave. Another order was  signed ordering Attorney Wiedenfeld as the special prosecutor. Atty Wiedenfeld gave Def all recordings but two interviews that do not exist. Def. states that his security system was ordered returned. Atty Wiedenfeld states that the securtiy system is currently being held. The order from the previous hearing is that Def can go to the Sheriff's Office to view. Atty Wiedenfeld requests that the video remain to be held. A copy of the video has not been given to the Def. 

BTC: Motion for the court to recuse itself is denied. Atty Wiedenfeld to reamin on case. Return of the equipment is not ordered at this time. Atty Wiedenfeld may give Def. a copy of the video. Atty Wiedenfeld to provide a written memo regarding discovery. Motion Hearing date to be set on 04/26/2018 at 1:30pm. Trial date to be set on 05/29/2018 at 1:30pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the co-defendants, SA and JG.   No contact with victim store, CREE Inc, except for restitution purposes.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant James A Barker in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant James A Barker in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
